alerts.headline: winter storm warning in effect
alerts.description:
Winter storm continues.

What:
Total snowfall amounts of 20 to 40 cm. 
Peak snowfall rates of 3 to 5 cm per hour. 
Poor visibility in heavy snow and local blowing snow. 

When: 
Continuing tonight and tapering off Thursday morning. 

Additional information: 
Northerly winds gusting to 50 km/h will result in areas of blowing snow, further reducing visibility.

###

Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Visibility will be suddenly reduced to near zero at times in heavy snow and blowing snow. Poor weather conditions may contribute to transportation delays.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
alerts.instruction: Consider postponing non-essential travel until conditions improve.

Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Visibility will be suddenly reduced to near zero at times in heavy snow and blowing snow. Poor weather conditions may contribute to transportation delays.

alerts.headline: squall warning in effect
alerts.description:
Wind gusts to 50 knots have been reported over land associated with an area of convective showers moving northeast from Ohio. These squalls may affect the marine areas of Lake St. Clair and western Lake Erie, especially near the shore.

###

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.
alerts.instruction: Mariners are advised to prepare for squalls. If underway, seek safe harbour immediately. Consider delaying or postponing travel in areas under the squall warning.

alerts.headline: winter storm warning in effect
alerts.description:
Winter storm continues.

What: 
Total snowfall amounts of 15 to 25 cm possible. 
Poor visibility in heavy snow and local blowing snow.

When: 
Tapering off this morning.

Additional information: 
Northerly winds gusting to 50 km/h will result in areas of blowing snow, further reducing visibility.

###

Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become difficult to navigate due to accumulating snow. Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become icy and slippery.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
alerts.instruction: Consider postponing non-essential travel until conditions improve.

affected_areas.area_description: Searchmont - Montreal River Harbour - Batchawana Bay
Sault Ste. Marie - St. Joseph Island

alerts.headline: wind warning in effect
alerts.description:
Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring.

An area of damaging wind gusts associated with a line of convective showers has been observed and may continue to push northeastward across portions of southwestern Ontario tonight.

Wind gusts to 90 km/h are possible.

###

Damage to buildings, such as to roof shingles and windows, may occur. Gusty winds can damage soft shelters, tents and awnings at outdoor events. Utility outages may occur.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
